text: I am Shabazz or mr. Q teaches an
energetic gym class for the young
students here every single pair we have
15 minutes of calisthenics this is
nothing unusual for a New York City
public school except that his class is
taught in English and in Hebrew the
Hebrew language Academy opened this year
in Brooklyn just the latest in a slew of
dual language programs in the city
Chinese Spanish and Greek programs have
existed for years the most surprising
thing is that the simplicity of it is
the power in it and not surprising to me
but I think my pleasure in seeing the
surprise on people's faces most of the
children come from Jewish backgrounds
but a third of the students are here
because their parents wanted something
different an alternative to their local
public schools and an opportunity to
learn a new language to know that I will
have a five year old learning Hebrew and
by the time he's you know seven nine he
could be English that's pretty cool mr.
Q didn't speak a word of Hebrew before
starting at the school but he loves to
flex his linguistic muscles a super set
of body postures rosh big O's 9i in hi
miss folks Jeff Dunham oh god that's so
and they say with me some of them can
say faster than me the diversity of the
children and the interaction between
them as they all learn a language
together is both a simple and powerful
concept
this is principal Campbell children are
learning adults are working together
we're engaging children in a process
where they're becoming either
multilingual or bilingual we aren't
doing anything astronomical but it's
just that it's a first
